title: end point
extract: endpoint (plural endpoints) Either of the two points at the ends of a line segment. (biology, medicine) A defined occurrence during the observation period of an experiment or study. (chemistry) The stage in a titration at which a change in the colour of an indicator indicates that no more titrant should be added.
extract_html: endpoint (plural endpoints) Either of the two points at the ends of a line segment. (biology, medicine) A defined occurrence during the observation period of an experiment or study. (chemistry) The stage in a titration at which a change in the colour of an indicator indicates that no more titrant should be added.
